poem:
**Child of Europe**

so much  
for "together"—  
a hand offered  
with a grip  
already set.

Munich:  
a hall of coats,  
the bright microphones  
like small altars.

America,  
child of Europe,  
speaks quick  
as a doctor in winter:  
this is your fate—  
sign here  
or I will treat myself alone.
